caption.p: Clinical presentation and diagnosis of patients with MERS who experienced neurological complications due to treatment

tr.td: Day 24 after initial onset of respiratory symptoms: hypersomnolence, weakness and ataxia and hyporeflexia in all limbs, bilateral ptosis and external ophthalmoplegia,
Diabetes mellitus, hypertension, chronic kidney disease, hypothyroidism, atrial fibrillation
Bickerstaff’s encephalitis overlapping with Guillain-Barré syndrome
Day 16 after MERS onset: tingling and stinging pain sensation in both and below knees, bilateral proximal dominant weakness in legs, hyporeflexia in both legs
Day 20 after MERS onset: tingling sensation in distal parts of hands and feet, hypesthesia in distal parts of all limbs, bilateral hyporeflexia in legs
Day 21 after MERS onset: tingling in both hands
Acute sensory neuropathy caused by toxin or infection
